sections.title: How the population has changed in your area - ONS
sections.description: Demographic trends in local authorities within the UK

sections.title: How the population has changed in Melton
sections.label: Select another area to see how the population has changed

sections.content: In 2020, Melton was the 34th largest local authority in the East Midlands, with a total population of 51,394. An increase compared with 2019.

sections.title: Largest local authorities in the East Midlands, 2002-2020
Population density in Melton
sections.content: In 2020, the population density in Melton was 107 people per square kilometre, which was less than the East Midlands (311), and less than the United Kingdom as a whole (276).

sections.title: Densest local authorities in the East Midlands, 2020
Median age in Melton
sections.content: In 2020, the median age in Melton was 48 years, which was older than the East Midlands (41 years), and older than the United Kingdom as a whole (41 years).

sections.title: Oldest local authorities in the East Midlands, 2020
